- Location: South-east door, left side of lintel  
- Date: Unknown, Domitian  
- [Hieroglyphic Text](https://www.ifao.egnet.net/uploads/publications/enligne/Temples-Esna002.pdf#page=205){target="_blank"}  
- Bibliography: @leitz-loeffler (non vidi)  
  
### Formula {-}  
  
<div class="col2">  
  
^1^ *mn n=k nḥp pfy  *  
  *mry ỉb=k  *  
*ỉn kȝ.t=k grg tȝ pn  *  
  
^1^ Take this potter's wheel,  
   which your heart loves:  
It is your work which settles this earth.  
  
</div>  
  
### The King {-}  
<div class="col2">  
  
^2^ *nsw.t-bỉty  *  
*(ỉwtkrtr ksrs) *  
^3^ *zȝ-Rʿ  *  
*(twm[...]) *  
^4^ *zȝ-mr=f*   
  *n nb-nḥp  *  
  
^2^ King of Upper and Lower Egypt,  
(Autokrator Caesar)  
^3^ Son of Re,  
(Dom[itian Augustus]),  
^4^ His-beloved-son priest [^fn-61-1]  
  of the Lord of the potter's wheel.  
  
</div>  
  
### Khnum-Re Lord of Esna {-}  
  
<div class="col2">  
  
^5^ *ḏd-mdw ỉn ẖnmw-Rʿ nb tȝ-sn.t  *  
^6^ *ḥry-nḥp   *  
*qdỉ r-mr=f  *  
*grg tȝ* ^7^ *m kȝ.t=f*  
    *rʿ-nb  *  
  
^5^ Words spoken by Khnum-Re Lord of Esna,  
^6^ chief of the potter's wheel,  
who builds as he desires,  
who settles the earth ^7^ through his work,  
   daily.  
  
</div>  
  
### Menhyt {-}  
<div class="col2">  
  
^8^ *ḏd-mdw ỉn Mnḥy.t wr.t*   
   *nb.t ḫnt-tȝ  *  
^9^ *msḫn.t nfr.t  *  
*ỉr(.t) mr=s * ^10^ [...]  
  
^8^ Words spoken by Menhyt the great,   
   Lady of Khent-ta,  
^9^ good birth-brick,  
who does what she desires ^10^ [...]  
  
</div>  
  
### Heka {-}  
<div class="col2">  
  
^11^ *ḏd-mdw ỉn ḥkȝ pȝ-ẖrd  *  
  *ʿȝ wr tpy [n] ẖnmw  *  
^12^ *sḏ ỉqr nn mỉt.t=f  *  
  
^11^ Words spoken by Heka the Child,  
  very great first-born [of] Khnum,  
^12^ excellent youth without his equal.  
</div>  
  
  
[^fn-61-1]: This is a common priestly title, most closely associated with Herishef in Herakleopolis Magna: @klotz-titles, p. 778 (with references). <!-- Todo: check Cauville, RdE 59, for where this title is used in offering scenes -->
